text.0: make ready that which passes thought in swiftness that hath three wheels and triple seat ye mighty.
text.1: whereon ye seek the dwelling of the pious whereon threefold ye fly like birds with pinions.
text.2: light rolls your easy chariot faring earthward what time for food ye full of wisdom mount it.
text.3: may this song wondrous fair attend your glory ye as ye travel wait on dawn heavens daughter.
text.4: ascend your lightly rolling car approaching the worshipper who turns him to his duties.
text.5: whereon ye come unto the house to quicken man and his offspring o nāsatyas heroes.
text.6: let not the wolf let not the shewolf harm you forsake me not nor pass me by or others.
text.7: here stands your share here is your hymn ye mighty yours are these vessels full of pleasant juices.
text.8: gotama purumīlha atri bringing oblations all invoke you for protection.
text.9: like one who goes straight to the point directed ye nāsatyas to mine invocation.
text.10: we have passed oer the limit of this darkness our praise hath been bestowed on you o aśvins.
text.11: come hitherward by paths which gods have travelled may we find strengthening food in full abundance.
